    • Method Detail

      • moveList

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> moveList​(java.util.List<T> list,
                                             int distance,
                                             java.util.function.Supplier<T> defaultValue)
        Moves all items within a list after the given distance. If an object is null or not available, it gets replaced with defaultValue. All items that get moved below index 0 get dropped. The given list pointer is being overwritten by the new, modified list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the list.
        Parameters:
        list - The list to move within.
        distance - The distance to move. Can be negative for downwards moving.
        defaultValue - A supplier to provide a default item if the index is unavailable.
        Returns:
        The modified list instance.

      • findComplex

        public static <A,​B> java.util.Optional<A> findComplex​(java.util.List<A> list,
                                                            B criteria,
                                                            java.util.function.Function<A,​B> criteriaExtractor)
        Search for an item within a list without having to modify the list. This way, you provide a Function to convert the list type of item into the criteria type of item.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the items in the list.
        B - The type of the criteria to search for.
        Parameters:
        list - The list to search in.
        criteria - An item to search for. Uses Object.equals(Object).
        criteriaExtractor - A function to modify each entry of the list to fit the search criteria.
        Returns:
        An Optional that may contain the found item.

        public static <T> boolean booleanOfAll​(java.util.List<T> list,
